item.description:
The Isabella Stewart Gardner Museum does a "Third Thursday" evening event each month.
This month's event is "Saturnalia"
Tonight’s the night to eat, drink, and be merry Roman-style! Explore the pagan side of the Gardner.

The evening includes:
Courtyard Music:
From 5:30-7pm and then again from 8:15-9pm.
Gallery Talk @ 7pm:
Stop by the special exhibition gallery for a talk by Eungie Joo, Keith Haring Director and Curator at the New Museum
Viewfinder Conversations:
Join a discussion about John S. Sargent’s famous portrait of Isabella Gardner (every half-hour), plus other impromptu gallery discussions (6 to 8:30PM)
Sketching in the Galleries:
Drop by the Titian Room and sketch for a while, from 6-9pm.

And whatever else lies in store!

For more info and to buy tickets, go to Gardner After Hours - December 2009
item.how_to_find_us: Meet at the entrance @ 5.30pm or inside the Museum thereafter
item.name: Isabella Stewart Gardner "After Hours" Evening
